website_summaries.verdict: For convenient printing on the go, the Brother PocketJet 7 PJ723-BK thermal printer offers maximum portability and high-quality output, particularly for text.
pros: Choice of paper stock includes cut sheet, roll, and fanfold formats
Optional accessories include a battery and cases
cons: Uses thermal paper with a distinct odor
Output quality is not a match for typical inkjets

customer_reviews.title: Discontinued before I even bought it
customer_reviews.text: It would be swell if Amazon could/would somehow indicate an item has been discontinued in the product description. I bought this just over a year ago and the company had announced they weren't going to sell them anymore a month before that. Now, a week out of warranty, my charger is busted and I can't get anyone at Mio/PAI to even return an email about how I can purchase a new one. The monitor itself works ok, but it can be a nuisance to get it to link up with my phone properly. Sometimes it takes half a dozen attempts to make it connect.
customer_reviews.author: Sr Ogan

customer_reviews.title: The monitor stopped charging after 11 month
customer_reviews.text: The problem with the charging appeared 11 months after the purchase. A long and exhausting e-mail conversation with the customer service led to nothing. Otherwise the monitor is pretty accurate and convenient to use. The software was great while it was working, but after 7 months of usage i was not able to connect to it any longer. The customer service suggested to switch to another non-original software from a different provider, and I did try, but didn't like it at the end. So i wish this monitor worked for me longer than 11 months or at least i could have replaced it with the working one.
customer_reviews.author: Vitaliy Selivanov

customer_reviews.title: This was recommended by a men's fitness magazine as one of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by a men's fitness magazine as one of the top heart rate monitors. I bought it because I didn't want to wear a strap on my chest. I couldn't get it to work. In my opinion, a big limitation on products that don't have a digital screen readout is that you have no idea what is going on with the device, and I couldn't get it to link up to my phone either. Maybe someone else will have better luck, but I think I'm going to just buy one of the strap versions, something that has a proven track record of working.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Nabors

customer_reviews.title: Mio Link? More like "meh-o" link.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, when it works, which is on short rides, most days. It doesn't have the battery life for any ride longer than 5 hours and some days you can take it off the cradle apparently fully charged, but still not get 30 minutes from the thing. I'm on my third one of these, so I know whereof I speak. Why three of them, if it is so mediocre? Because I really hate chest strap monitors. If that's you too, then this might be the device for you. (Also, the charging cradle is really poorly designed. There are four delicate little pins that easily get pushed down, after which it is really finicky to get the device to charge.)
customer_reviews.author: Achille Bedard

customer_reviews.title: Great product, had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with this product. It does what its supposed to. However I had to return it because it doesnt work with Orange Theory fitness (even though is the same model they sell at their facilities, except for different color). Contacted support who suggested to do all the firmware updates. Took it to OT and couldnt get the id off of the watch to plug into the gym system.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Complete rubbish if you want to accurately record your HR for cycling.
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is completely inaccurate for cycling. It won't maintain a consistent reading and varies 15 - 20 bpm when I'm at a constant power output. On a descent when my HR was 80 bpm, it wouldn't register less than 105 bpm and would go as high as 120. It would increase 10 bpm just pedaling backwards. I tried it on both arms, on the front, on the back and all up and down my forearm. I tried tightening the strap, loosening the strap and it never worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Accurate RHR and HR during runs
customer_reviews.text: It is accurate for measuring resting heart rate and heart rate during my runs. Resting heart rate I had my annual checkup and my RHR was 58. I have a Suunto HRM which recorded my RHR at the low 40s which is dead wrong. So I put this on and left my phone on and the Mio mobile app running when I went to bed. Mio recorded my RHR at 58 which is spot-on. Heart rate during runs My Suunto HRM and Mio link gave the same readings while I was running.
customer_reviews.author: GPaige

customer_reviews.title: That's nice I guess
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Mio LINK for 2 years and 3 months. It worked okay when it did work. It had some trouble with accurately counting heart rate when cycling. My Mio LINK suddenly stopped working altogether a few days ago. It is out of warranty by now but Mio offered me a 20% discount coupon on future purchases. That's nice I guess, but I don't think I want to buy another after the previous track record.
customer_reviews.author: Charlain Engels

customer_reviews.title: 15 Months in and still love it
customer_reviews.text: I have had the Mio LINK for over a year now. I use it for runs 5-6 days a week and find that it is very accurate for running. I have paired it with my Garmin 620 and Garmin Fenix 3 and it has work well with both (the ANT range is better on the Fenix 3). The band is comfortable and you quickly forget you are wearing it. At a couple thousands miles of use while running it is still looks like new with only a quick rinse after use.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Nice, reliable heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this! I have a drawer full of heart rate monitors including two polar heart rate monitors with chest straps and a Samsung gear fit. This little guy has been fabulous. I use it with my fitness pro and it records my heart rate reliably. It does not slip and seems to handle sweat well. I use it in the gym and while running. If you are looking for just a reliable heart rate monitor like I was, this is your baby. With the chest straps I would loose connectivity at various points. With the Samsung, it would stop reading as soon as I got sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: clkelley

customer_reviews.title: Better than a chest strap
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my Garmin Forerunner 620 for a couple months now. It's been pretty reliable. Sometimes it starts out high or low for a minute, but then settles down. I like it because I can wear it on my wrist, and avoid abrasion from a strap on my chest. That was getting painful. Too have this work well, it needs to be pretty tight on your upper wrist, so it won't slide, and so the LEDs are firmly against the skin. I usually don't like tight wristbands, wearing my watch a little loose, but this is not uncomfortable. The wrist band has some stretch too it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Ethier

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: It worked very well at the first 2-3 months. It was accurate, comfortable, and easy-to-charge. But in 2-3 months, everything went wrong. I had to try more than 10 times whenever I want to charge the device. The cradle didn't work very well. And the signal dropped quite often, like 2-3 times per minute. I will never use Mio device again in my life. I strongly recommend you not to buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Heebong R.

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Customer
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several times to get this thing to work and it's just not happening. What they don't tell you is that you need a Windows computer to activate the dam thing and it just so happens that I own a Mac. At this point I feel like I've thrown $80 in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Kewley

customer_reviews.title: Very inaccurate, if you get a unit that connects at all.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one and had connection issues (bluetooth) so I figured I had a bad unit. Got a replacement and while i haven't any connection issues, it's horribly inaccurate. I verified it's not a bluetooth thing by connecting to my Garmin watch (ANT+) and it's consistently way off the mark (20+bpm). I tried tightening it to the point of being uncomfortable, I even tried flipping it and wearing it on the inside of my wrist (I'm fairly hairy so I thought that might be the issue). No dice, it registers a heartrate it's just woefully inaccurate. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: roidster

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after 5 month of use
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 5 month of use - purchased in Nov/2015, worked fine until Apr/2016 when it suddenly stopped and wouldn't turn on again - with no plausible explanation. Firmware was update on Mar/2016 without any issue - it was communicating perfectly, with a stable signal/data stream to both my Garmin Edge 520 (ANT+) and iPhone 6S (Bluetooth) using Apps (Strava, Wahoo Fitness, Mio GO). It was a perfect option for the uncomfortable chest strap HRMs, but turned out to be unreliable non-lasting piece of electronics!!! Waiting for Feedback from MioGlobal. In the meantime started shopping for an alternative as I desperately need and HRM for my bike training.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more chest belt!
customer_reviews.text: It worked right away with my regular exercise app (endomondo), even when skin is completely dry, unlike the chest straps, which require the contacts to be moistened! It seems to be reasonably accurate. OTOH, the medium size is way too small for medium sized man. So I gave it to my medium sized wife. It fits comfortably and worked at the first try as well with her app. The official MIO go app is kinda lame right now without the HealthKit integration. Don't bother unless you're just curious, as MIO works with many other apps just fine. I just ordered a large size and hope it's a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: comfortable functionality
customer_reviews.text: although I've never tried chest straps. this one felt simply like my daily resin watch strap. 3 Color mode provided a double blinker instead of the 5 mode system which blink a little too slow and you had to take your eyes of the road longer. I currently find this useful in trying to run past my 90% HR on tempos. potential uses are for long distance ultras and cycles. great product! although having it keeps you informed. I felt that we could still gauge our HR pretty accurately. something we could do without specially on temos
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough, but I had trouble getting it ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, but I had trouble getting it to work under water for swimming. I had read some reviews where it was supposed to handle that well enough, but I had to fiddle with it all the time until I got some stable readings. After some runs it was not working again. It was not the connection, as it rarely disconnected, it had difficulty reading the HR.
customer_reviews.author: Tiago Daitx

customer_reviews.title: Not so good.
customer_reviews.text: The charging cord is too short. The charging module is not so easy to use. You have to remove the sensor from the band and hope that all the contacts line up, even when it feels like it is engaged, it might not be. And it has to be a bit tight on the wrist to get a consistent signal. I think the Scosche Rhythm Plus is a better product. For some, it will still be more comfortable than a chest strap.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Mushnick

customer_reviews.title: Good for running not so good for biking
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine for running. I connect to my Garmin 220 with no problem. It is very comfortable. The problem comes in when I use it for biking. It connects easily to my Garmin 810 and stays connected through half of a 3 hour bike ride. Half way through the bike ride it looses connectivity and I am unable to regain it again. I do not know what the problem is. I have it properly positioned on my wrist and it does not move around.
customer_reviews.author: L. E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One of the few accurate wrist-based HR monitors out there
customer_reviews.text: HR monitoring is essential to effective training. Mio is one of the few brands that gives you an accurate reading through wrist based technology. I've used Mio for years (for my own training and testing hundreds of athletes), and it is the only wrist-based HR monitor which gives an accurate reading every time. I'm surprised to see reviews stating the contrary. I recommend it to all the athletes I work with (and use it with my training on a daily basis) and have always relied on it for its accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: SDW

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Never used a heart rate monitor before. Works great for me. Don't have nothing to compare against, but based on previous knolewdege, HR seems to be accurate. Band is comfortable and never had issues with cell phone connectivity (moto g). Keep in mind that this uses Bluetooth Smart, for Android you need version 4.3 minimum. The charger is OK, no issues. Unless you have really really small wrists, order the LARGE size, they are smaller than you may think. You can always use it higher in the arm.
customer_reviews.author: elismas

customer_reviews.title: so convenient.
customer_reviews.text: This band is not quite as responsive as the Polar, BUT, it's way more convenient and comfortable. I put it about 2 inches from my wrist, and pull it pretty tight, and it seems very accurate, but it just takes a second to register. I actually like this because I end up paying attention to my heart more than my digital readout. It's about a 5-10 second delay at times when heart rate spikes. I love it and use it way more than my uncomfortable heart rate straps.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Good Concept - Horrible "support" and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great product...only when it works and if it would have customer support. It stopped working about a week after it arrived. I have tried to call customer support and 2 days later, I managed to get someone who basically told me to return it to vendor as they did not know how to fix this issue (??!!!). Great concept, is a coin toss if it will work, and practically no real support. Ummm.. not for this price.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Product.  I highly recommend.  No Chest Strap Needed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear this Mio Link every day. I have it on right now! It works great with my iPhone 4S. Easy to set up and very accurate. NO CHEST STRAP which is a huge plus!!!!! It looks nice too. Even if I go out for a dressy event I can wear this and I put nice bracelets with it. People like to ask about it and I've recommended it many times. Great product! NOTE: If you wear perfume, the strap will absorb the aroma!
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Good heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Good heart rate monitor. The best, basic heart rate monitor you can get if you plan to use it with other apps like Runtastic or Endomondo. The Mio app stinks and despite giving you the option to change your heart rate zones for the blinking LED, they reset to default every time you close the app. This makes the color changing LED somewhat irrelevant, but if you are using an app on your phone to track your heart rate, distance, speed, etc. then it is of little consequence.
customer_reviews.author: Sea2TX

customer_reviews.title: The Mio Link
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the accuracy of the MIO Link, in my exercise. The HRM did not have issues with accuracy for me, it does have one issue that detracted 2 stars from my rating: The LED zone colors, orange and red are too close together in nature and can be confusing for a quick glance at my wrist. The color progression would be better Blue, Green, YELLOW (instead of Orange,) Red. I hope someone from MIO reads this posting
customer_reviews.author: Robyn M

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose very well
customer_reviews.text: I use this on a Concept2 model E indoor rower with PM5, plus the ErgData app and the MapMyFitness app simultaneously. The trick is to link the MMF app via Bluetooth and the PM5&ErgData app via Ant+ or you won't get multiple tracking info. Also, to get sleep info an any give night, use MMF app and select rest day activity for your sleeping exercise and let it run all night.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Mio LINK doesn't go the distance.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mio LINK to use while cycling 5 months ago. It worked great at first but now there are two issues. 1. Inaccurate readings. Randomly in the middle of a work out it will show a reading of 60-75 bpm while I'm attacking a hill. I'm basically anaerobic at this point and it takes quite a while for the monitor to start working normally again. 2. Holding charge. After fully charging the unit it barely lasts for 5 hours. At this point the Mio LINK is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: I wish I had paid more and gone with the mio alpha or the mio surge . I thought the idea of not actually seeing your heart rate but instead seeing a green or red light telling you what zone you were in during your workout sounded good but it's become more of a distraction . I like Mio app and I like the brand . I admit this has a nice look but I find I leave it at home more often then taking it with me on my runs .My husband meanwhile has the Mio Alpha and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: bookie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love, love
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love, love, LOVE my Mio LINK. This heart rate monitor was exactly what I was looking for. I wanted something to help me train better, but I didn't want one of the antiquated chest strap heart rate monitors. This is accurate and stays in place and connected. The information it provides is invaluable and it syncs to my favorite apps which is even better. In addition, it's extremely comfortable to wear. I couldn't have chosen a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: After a little over a year and a half, it stopped working. I tried calling the company but their phone number doesn’t work. I tried tweeting the company but I was not allowed to.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie

customer_reviews.title: Mio is great for triathletes. Under cycling shorts. In the pool. Better than a chest strap any day.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. I lost the first one and loved it so much i got another one. I'm a triathlete and hate chest straps. This is great. Mio is terrific. you can pop out the pod and slip it under your cycling shorts and you don't have to wear the wrist strap. Mio also works in the pool. You can read about my experiences with Mio in my blog posts here: (...) (...) (...)
customer_reviews.author: J. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Works great. No more cost strap!
customer_reviews.text: I never have a problem acquiring my heart rate and the band is really comfortable and won't come off accidently. I got the medium / regular, which just barely fits me. I'd opt for the large if I did it again, but it fits. Though the instructions recommend wearing it up closer to your forearm when biking for better consistency in reading your pulse. I'll probably just get a replacement band later on. I used the Mio link app on my note 3 for setup without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: but when it stays put this is really comfortable. I just wish the battery lasted more than ...
customer_reviews.text: The clasp keeps wanting to come open, but when it stays put this is really comfortable. I just wish the battery lasted more than 6-7 hours for things like Ironman and ultramarathons. A solution is to have two sensors ready but that doubles the cost of course. Optical is the way to go though. There's no going back to chest straps for me. I didn't mind chest straps but this is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn

customer_reviews.title: Great HRM
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product, very useful, it took me only a couple of hours to get used to the colors, plus you can always see accurate information from the cell. I begin to use to train on the bike, with Endomondo is a perfect complemented and I use with a windows phone. also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny De Castro

customer_reviews.title: can not charge unit
customer_reviews.text: Worked well until the charging unit failed. One of the spring loaded pins that make contact to the wrist band has lost its spring and will not make contact so the unit it not usable. Very disappointed would like to find another charging unit to get me back up and working again.
customer_reviews.author: William Rawlinson

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, happy with one of them
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units (one for me and one for my wife). Mine works great and has never cut out on me. I kept it and am very happy with it. My wife's unit, on the other hand, did not work correctly since the first day it arrived and the heart rate would cut out every 5 minutes or so during her workout. We tried multiple locations on her wrist and nothing seemed to help. We sent hers back and purchased the Scosche Rhythm + and she has had no issues with that.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Gunther

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable, accurate HR monitor
customer_reviews.text: I use this to track my HR when cycling. I paired with Runkeeper & it works great. I get audio ques regarding my HR average and current HR. Just what I wanted. It is not uncomfortable, nor does it slide. I wear the electrodes on the under side of my arm, as recommended for cycling. I also asked the nurse at work to check the accuracy with her equipment. It was very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: G Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This is SO much better than a chest strap!!! FINALLY! Gives accurate readings and there's no drama with moisture and slipping etc. UPDATE, 5 months of use - very accurate, I am SO happy with this. It will last for my half ironman and i will put a second one in my special needs bag for the full ironman. 7 - 8 hours is plenty of battery life. NO MORE NASTY CHEST STRAPS!!!!!!!!!!!! YAY!
customer_reviews.author: ThePugetSound

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it but I can't trust the readings
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it but I can't trust the readings. Usually about once per workout, when I try and raise my heart rate the device shows my HR dropping. then it jumps from say 115 to 185 in one update and then I see I overshot my HR target. It's also really annoying when you know you've got to be around 150-160 and it shows you at a stable 120. I've tried the recommendations on the companies website for fixing the issue. Going to go buy a chest strap. Wasted a good bit of $$.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Statham

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get it to work at all after trying for an hour. The instructions are very scant. Their app has one star on iTunes right now with most also complaining they can't connect. Good thing Amazon makes it easy to return.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Herz

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it but..
customer_reviews.text: I connected to a galaxy tablet for about an hour and then after that I could not connect again. After that I took the device off my grandfathers wrist and the zone colors were changing while it wasnt even on a wrist. It would go from the lowest zone to the highest zone. We returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Manina

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but did not work for me biking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a substitute for a chest strap, to measure heart rate while biking. It never worked for me. The wristband is not particularly comfortable on the bike because it has to be worn fairly high up on the forearm, and the measured heart rare was about 15-20 bpm below that measured by the chest strap. It also didn't respond as quickly as the chest strap. This may work for other sports but I wouldn't recommend it for biking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a short time
customer_reviews.text: It worked reasonably well for a month. Tech support did help me reset it when it failed during a software update. The strap was adequate but would not stay fastened. Most recently it has gone dead and now it will not charge. It is totally non-responsive. I have decided to go with another product.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Shaffer Sr

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, good alternative to a HR strap. No skin irritation, fits well with adjustable band. Easy to sync with Garmin. My only compliant is that you can't tell when the battery is going to die so you have to remember to charge. I charge it when my garmin battery gets to 50% and then again when I charge the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Wrong size wrist band.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this 4 stars instead of 5 because I ordered a "Large" strap (which is stated on the bottom of the box), but is came with a (S/M) strap as labelled on the front of the box. This one is being returned; hope the second one comes with the correct wrist band, as I could barely get it on my wrist. The Mio Link was tested and works flawlessly. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Easy Bluetooth link to iPhone apps
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was seeking. Simple intuitive setup. Easy Bluetooth link to iPhone 6 plus apps. The camera heart rate apps are great but you cannot move while using them. Consistent with other heart rate measures. Unobtrusive stylish comfortable. The chest strap is unacceptably ridiculous. Great cyber Monday price. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Rey

customer_reviews.title: Great when the battery is charged
customer_reviews.text: It works great on the non MIO app (I disklike the MIO app) but every time the battery drops below 40% the connectivity to my pulse gets pretty bad- like I’ll be sprinting and it’ll read my pulse as “warm up.” If it’s fully charged it reads fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W

customer_reviews.title: Great for Peleton app.
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn’t work out but I have friends who are using it with Peloton app and They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Ramin

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects literally every time I give it a chance
customer_reviews.text: Device worked fine for a month or so, then it began disconnecting constantly from both Bluetooth or Any+. It worked just long enough to make a return impossible. So now I'm stuck with a $80 piece of junk. Nothing more frustrating than ending a grueling workout to see the device has disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Perez

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, sync is straight foward. Readings ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, sync is straight foward. Readings I received are as accurate as anything else I own. The negative would bebattery life.It definetly will not last all day long if you are trying to monitor your heart on a daily basis however, it will give you 6-7 hours.
customer_reviews.author: GSXR1000

customer_reviews.title: It would not give proper HR readings. When I ...
customer_reviews.text: It would not give proper HR readings. When I got it and put it on, my HR reading was in the Red zone, which is the highest. I was just sitting on my couch. I then waited a few minutes and it wen into the lowest zone. Then I got up from the sofa and it immediately went back into the red zone.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Simply great!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: I had 'issues' with the HR cutting out on Ant+. The Mio team replied to my feedback telling me to keep the watch on the same side as the MIO band and all my issues are resolved. It's been dependable - and probably would be even better using the bluetooth because of the issue I had with ANT+ (not an issue with the Mio). Thanks again.
customer_reviews.author: pg

customer_reviews.title: It wears nice on the wrist and appears to be very accurate
customer_reviews.text: I've been very impressed with this heart rate monitor. It wears nice on the wrist and appears to be very accurate. I also have a chest strap monitor and they read the same BPM consistently. I regularly use it with two Android apps on my phone: iCardio and Endomondo. It works with other Android apps but these two are my favorites. The battery holds up for several days of workouts using it about an hour each time. I usually charge it every 3-4 days even though it still has plenty of juice. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K

customer_reviews.title: MIO great for cycling and other cardio training classes like MOI
customer_reviews.text: Great way to monitor heart rate for cardio especially cycling classes. You can get the Mio app on Google Play and see it on your smart phone. I recommend you charge it after each use.
customer_reviews.author: debra kaplan

customer_reviews.title: This IS the HR monitor you've been looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Finally a real HR monitor that I can use with my phone and eventually headset wearables like the Recon Jet using its Ant+ connection. Great transmission to my phone using Bluetooth and the MapMyRide fitness app. Now my workouts make more sense and are more enjoyable and worth while.
customer_reviews.author: SAL

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I've suffered chest straps until I just couldn't stand them anymore. I had gotten to the point where I just gave up on recording my heart rate in workouts. Now with this Mio, I'm back to recording heart rate. You have to wear it snug, but snug on the arm is much better than snug and clammy around your chest!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy J

customer_reviews.title: Better than the best chest strap.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down, far better and more accurate than any chest strap I've used in the past. It easily syncs to your iPhone or android via Bluetooth, and you can leave it on for a full day to monitor your post run recovery and stress points. It's quick and easy to charge, and even easier to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Idiocractic

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Light, & Accurate
customer_reviews.text: For anyone interested in heart rate based training, this is the wearable for you. Tested against a Polar chest strap, it was within 2 bpm's consistently at all levels, and usually within 1 bpm. Comfortable, Light, and Accurate. Great heart rate monitor, especially when paired with Digifit on iPhone 6.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 9 year old daughter who has to ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 9 year old daughter who has to monitor her heart rate during exercise. She doesn't have to watch a number, just keep in the allowed color zones. Can adjust heart rate color zones via online acess.
customer_reviews.author: KathOLeen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't connect with the app on my iphone so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My monitor didn't come with a code so I can't ...
customer_reviews.text: My monitor didn't come with a code so I can't sync it with other systems or use it for Orange Theory Fitness which is the whole reason I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Bonifazi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to avoid the chest strap
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to avoid the chest strap, accurate. Don't care much about the Mio app since I have paired with my suunto ambit. One thing: You have to wear it (at list with my watch), in the same wrist, otherwise the signal becomes bad
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Gallo Olvera

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great multipurpose training tool!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Small and comfortable package means that you don't have to use the chest strap. ANT+ and BT lets you use your Garmin or your Smart Phone to track your workout with your preferred device... or you can just watch the little flashing lights to determine what zone you're in! Triple threat! Nice! I've been using HRM for for ~20 years and jumped at the chance to finally get rid of the tight chest strap. This little device lets you exercise your way without the tell tale chest strap - you just have to remember to charge it between long uses - no biggie for all the upside!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan A Smith

customer_reviews.title: is comfortable, and holds a charge well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because I was tired of fighting with the chest strap to my Garmin. This syncs perfectly, is comfortable, and holds a charge well. Highly recommended to anyone who is aggravated by the sports-bra/chest strap interface!
customer_reviews.author: MsHoward

customer_reviews.title: Not completely accurate
customer_reviews.text: Still has a way to go to compete with chest straps for precision and reliability. Takes 15 - 30 minutes to record accurate reading. Easier in the summer, when sweat softens skin enough for monitor to detect volume tissue changes consistent with heart beat. Arm swing also causes small volume changes, and the device has a tendency to record that over actual heart beat at first.
customer_reviews.author: Manusman

customer_reviews.title: works well!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical but this device works. Far more comfortable than a chest strap. Readings appear to be accurate working with Runrastic Pro. No problems to report. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: L. Prokopets

customer_reviews.title: ... pros on this device is that it is very easy to set-up
customer_reviews.text: The pros on this device is that it is very easy to set-up, lightweight and solidly made. The wrist band is very comfortable. When I wear it for running, I haven't had any problems with the device picking up my heart rate, and I would recommend it if that is your only use. However, when I wear the device in the gym or for crossfit types of workouts, it is not able to sustain an accurate reading. I have tried positioning the band at various spots on my forearm and nothing has helped. I suspect any type of arm movement with weights, push-ups, pull-ups, etc. throw off the reading.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Good first attempt at a non chest strap heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: If you tighten the strap to where it *almost* cuts off circulation to your arm, it works fairly well. These require the absence of daylight to work properly, so if any light gets in - the HR will jump.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my Digifit app to monitor my heart rate during workouts & with another app to track/graph my heart rate during the day. It goes for hours before needing a recharge. I have gotten 6 hrs of continuous monitoring before needing to recharge. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: MGL

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because it did not sync with my work out facility
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Wilt

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough, but watch out for used item from Amazon warehouse
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for the one day that I worn it for my bike ride. I bought it from Amazon Warehouse as a returned item. And there was a reason why this one was returned. It did not say in the strap very well; keeping falling out of the rubber strap. I promptly lost it the next day. So Amazon sold me a crappy item, and I lost $100.
customer_reviews.author: N. Ta

customer_reviews.title: Paired great with my Garmin watch and worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Paired great with my Garmin watch and worked perfectly. That is, until it just quit and died on me a few months later. Even after proper care, washing, etc. it just didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: theSpaniard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool device
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool device, I like it way better than the chest strap that I used to use. I am taking it down one star though because I have to wear it so tight on my wrist. I have to wear it very tightly on my wrist to get accurate results and it leaves the band impression for several minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Arkalala

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the chest strap NOW!
customer_reviews.text: This was an Amazon Warehouse used item that arrived as good as new without the box. Not a scratch on it and I saved $29.00. The band works well and is as accurate as any chest strap. No more chest strap...yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I always had problems with HR monitors falling to my waist. No worries here. After months of use, it has been reliable and comfortable. I wish there was a battery indicator, the battery life is too good to recharge every night, but not good enough to last a week. So it falls into an odd place where you find out it needs charging when you use it.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Leach

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Very accurate hr reading
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Very accurate hr reading. The light that tells you what zone you are in is more helpful to us than knowing exactly what number your heart rate is. Does what it says and at half the price of the other products out there.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyMom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Finds my heart rate quickly. Comfortable to wear. Easy and fast to charge. Syncs to my Garmin devices toot sweet. Perfect HRM.
customer_reviews.author: M. Burkey

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a chest strap
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Works very well for running, cycling, and weight lifting. Works with my iPhone 6 using wahoo, strava, and moov flawlessly. Only thing that could make it better is a screen to display the HR.
customer_reviews.author: Sam H.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 4 1/2 months then just died
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 4 1/2 months then just died. Tried all the trouble shooting and even asked the folks at Orange Theory and they said it happens sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy R.

customer_reviews.title: Charging is hit and miss
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this product when in use. It gives me freedom from the traditional chest straps. However charging the Mio is very frustrating. It is hard to get a good connection on the copper electrodes. When I do have a connection, if it shifts at all it will stop charging.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Indrieri

customer_reviews.title: Best replacement for the Garming Ant+ Strap
customer_reviews.text: It rocks, I got tired of forgetting to put on my Garmin chest strap and needed to take my jersey/bib off to do so. This wears like a watch and works great, no complains.
customer_reviews.author: Duvi

customer_reviews.title: She is more active and happier and she is losing the bit of weight her ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my mom. She loves it! She has convinced many others to get one. She is more active and happier and she is losing the bit of weight her doctor has advised her to drop.
customer_reviews.author: Dannielle A.

customer_reviews.title: Works! Better than HR man-bras.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes "hiccups" at about 12 minutes into a workout, and heart rate goes from 80-ish to realistic 160. Must be worn snugly. Otherwise flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Nadz

customer_reviews.title: Paired easily with iPhone 4S, MapMyRun, and Runkeeper
customer_reviews.text: Love the design on this HR monitor! Now, I'll get more accurate results from my runs... Used it today with the Mapmyrun app, but if I want more info I'll have to upgrade to MVP. I'll see how well Runkeeper works tomorrow... may end up switching apps.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob G. Masdanian

customer_reviews.title: Pairing issues frustrate me on a daily basis. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Pairing issues frustrate me on a daily basis. The Transmitter does not have enough power or throughout to reliably hold and pair on a continuous basis.
customer_reviews.author: CPI

customer_reviews.title: OK for just bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: It's was OK initially, the bluetooth worked as it synced with my phone. I returned it due to it not giving the gym equipment with ANT+ any numbers and it turning itself off while I'm working out. I had the strap tight on my wrist about 1 /12 inches up and it would still turn off about 30 minutes into the workout. I purchased it specifically to feed the gym equipment and my phone at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kunst

customer_reviews.title: tracks and has good range. The charging unit is small and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I exercise at least 5 times a week. The heart rate monitor keeps up and tracks/records all my sessions. Syncs with my phone, tracks and has good range. The charging unit is small and it does not take long to recharge- the charge lasts for about 3-4 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: many issues. sync probs, charging unreliable,
customer_reviews.text: many issues. sync probs, charging unreliable, dont count on it to work
customer_reviews.author: ComputerGenius

customer_reviews.title: Mio no
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work at all despite following all directions. A great idea for a fitness product that fails utterly. Very disappointed in this product and the people behind Mio
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best strapless HRM on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for Beachbody workouts, Insanity, P90X, Running, etc. The key to keeping a solid heart rate is to have the unit higher on the forearm, about 2" above where a watch would be.
customer_reviews.author: Mark and Julie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for about a month. .. works just right! Easy to see LED and helps me pace myself. Comfortable to wear and easy to operate. Slightly annoying to link it to phone each time, but a minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Practicing Engineer

customer_reviews.title: No More Heart Strap that feels like a Moobs Bra
customer_reviews.text: It is a great add on, and it replaces the heart strap monitor for my Forerunner 220. Now it doesn't feel like I am wearing a bra. My only complaint , and it's minor, is that the charging apparatus has a short cord. It could use a longer one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best used with the free app
customer_reviews.text: Without question the most continuously reliable heart rate monitor for fitness. Only problem is that the app is quite weak, best used with the free app Wahoo
customer_reviews.author: Keith Aspinall

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasts for much longer than I expected. I have found the monitor to be very accurate in both running and biking. It pairs to my garmin easily and the data is helpful. I love how the unit itself shows a zone by blinking a set color. It's comvenient to know where I stand fairly instantly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nissen

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to Mio FUSE and love it.
customer_reviews.text: Was decent but purchased it for heart rate tracking of swim, and the distance limitations of Bluetooth were too much for accurate data to be captured even in 25m pool. Upgrade to Mio FUSE and love it.
customer_reviews.author: MrWizard

customer_reviews.title: Battery is only good for about 5 hours as opposed to the advertised ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well and pairs with my Iphone readily. Synchs with the apps I use. Battery is only good for about 5 hours as opposed to the advertised 8 hours, however, that has not been an issue for the way I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Benson

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, useless after a month or two of use
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for the first month, then stopped giving steady accurate readings. Now it's basically useless. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sam M.

customer_reviews.title: Great HR band but...
customer_reviews.text: I don't have an abnormally large wrist but the S/M size barely fit. I returned it for the large. The iPhone works fine but is still lacking as it's still in development at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

product_meta.title: Mio LINK Heart Rate Monitor Wrist Band
product_meta.description: Discover the freedom of running, cycling and swimming without the discomfort of a heart rate monitor chest strap. Mio LINK tracks your heart rate with precision from the wrist, so you can train with heart and train in comfort. Picture the beat of your heart on the screen of your favorite fitness app, alongside your speed and cadence sensors. With built-in Bluetooth Smart and ANT+ connectivity, Mio LINK frees you to connect and share your fitness data in real-time with dozens of popular iPhone and Android fitness apps, GPS watches, and bike computers.
feature_bullets: Comfortable and more accurate alternative to a chest strap.
Transmit heart rate to smartphone, GPS watch & bike computer.
Sync wirelessly via Bluetooth Smart (4.0) to popular fitness apps.
5 heart rate zones with colored LED lights.
Water resistant up to 30m (3 ATM / 100 ft.)
Compatible with Mio PAI app (Personal Activity Intelligence).
For Mio product support, please contact 1-877-770-1116 (Mon-Fri: 9am to 5pm PST). Please review the User Manual for more information
